alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 6:29AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Strong Storm To Hit West Coast of Alaska Tonight And Monday... A very strong storm moving northeast across the Bering Sea on today will move to near St Lawrence Island on Monday, and to just west of the Bering Strait on Tuesday. This storm will bring snow and strong winds to St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta late tonight, and all of the West Coast and the Southwest Interior on Monday, with snow and winds lasting into Tuesday. This is expected to cause blizzard conditions along much of the West Coast from the Bering Strait south through Tuesday, and bring snow and blowing snow to the Southwest Interior and the West Coast north of the Bering Strait on Monday and Tuesday. Expect between 2 and 8 inches inches of snow between late tonight and Tuesday over the area southwest of Buckland and McGrath, with the heaviest snow along south facing slopes such as the Nulato Hills and the higher terrain just north of Nome. This system may also cause water to rise up through cracks in the sea ice and push water on top of the ice in some areas on Monday and Tuesday. Some coastal trails on the ice or near the shore could become inundated with water.
